column1: on a length around the fifth stump, Amla defends off the backfoot
floated on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
slips a full ball down leg. De Kock can't get bat on that in his attempt to tickle it down
corrects his line, at length around middle, de Kock blocks
right behind the line of the length ball as he defends again
once again sneaks one down leg. Hasn't yet found the ideal line for the left-hander. More exercise for Ian Gould
this time better: full and shapes away from off stump, eased to cover
lands this full on off stump, firmly driven to mid-off
hint of swing. Moves away from outside off, Amla watches it through to the keeper
too straight. This one skids back in towards middle and leg, whipped into the midwicket region. Excellent running
back of length on middle, de Kock stays back and defends
nips back in from length on middle and leg, de Kock rolls his wrists over the delivery in defence
floats this much fuller on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
right behind the line of the full ball as he bunts it back to the bowler
full-length delivery on off stump, Amla solid in defence
length on off stump, Amla wrists this wide of midwicket
driven wide of mid-off. this was a slower delivery. De Kock picked it off the hand
uppish but wide of point, down to square third man. Looked to hit it hard, didn't quite have the room to play a full-blooded cut
opens the face of the bat to steer the short of length delivery to third man
touch wide outside off, punched to cover

de Kock struck on the back pad as he prods outside the line of that length ball. Pitch map suggests half the ball pitched inside the line, and ball tracking suggests it would've just clipped the stumps. Since the on-field decision was not-out, the umpire's call will stay. Sri Lanka have lost their review.
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
play and miss. Looks to pull but was cramped for room. Through with the stroke before the ball arrived
once again plays down the wrong line. Prods half-heartedly to get a thick inside edge onto the pad
tap and run. Mid-off had to hurry in but de Kock beat him to the single
flicked but straight to square leg. Lakmal lucky to get away with the 'hit-me half-volley.'
floats this full and close to the stumps, defended using the full face of the bat
too full around off, squeezed to mid-off. Pressure building? Excellent so far from Sri Lanka
varies his pace, slower at length on off, de Kock doesn't quite get to the pitch of the ball,  bunted back
flicked, but straight to midwicket. Fetched it from middle and off
off-cutter which de Kock chops down to third man
punches a length ball straight to extra cover
floated full outside off, de Kock gets across the stumps to whip it to deep midwicket
slides into middle and leg, Amla all balance and composure as he flicks this into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
wrists a length ball wide of mid-on as they scamper a single
looks to flay this through the off side but mistimes the cut to cover point
short delivery angling away, but not so far to be called wide either. Harsh call, I reckon. De Kock tried to slash that through point but missed.
chopped on, nearly. Looked to force this through cover but the ball didn't quite come on there, down to short fine leg
lovely drive, but can't thread the off side field. Straight to cover
slower, fuller and he's caressed that. First boundary of the game. De Kock held his shape, leant into it and sliced the drive. Was a conscious effort not to go hard at it
deceived. 68mph cutter that grips and spins away, de Kock squared up. Beaten
another slower ball, this one on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
runs the length ball down to third man and jogs the single
punched to mid-off. Was deep inside the crease when he started the run and in the end had to slide full-length in to beat the throw. Lucky his knee didn't quite get stuck into the ground
defends a slower delivery to the off side
beauty! Feeble push at a length ball that nips away off the seam. Tried to play with an angled bat
firm push but straight to mid-off again
steers the length ball behind point for a quick single
slower on middle and leg, nurdled to the right of short fine leg
squared up as he defends that length ball that nips away slightly, defended off the backfoot
works the length ball on middle to deep square leg
on a length around off stump, defended off the backfoot
punches the back of length delivery straight to cover
looks to force this through the off side but gets a thick inside edge towards the bowler. The ball veered back in from outside off
once again looks to smash the cover off the ball, thread the off side ring, gets an inside edge to the leg side as they scamper a run.
works the length ball on off stump to the leg side
on the move as he looks to flick, but played straight back to the bowler
outstanding stop by Kapugedara at point. Lovely square drive, he threw himself to his left to effect a one-handed stop
right behind the line of that full-length delivery on off stump
nips back in from length on off stump, defended to the leg side. Looked to hit it straighter but the bat face turned in his hand
tickled fine, but straight to the man at the edge of the ring at short fine. Boundary opportunity missed
first real sign of authority from Amla. Not all that bad a delivery but he uses his wrists to flick this length ball on middle over the infield. Lovely
back of length on off stump, bunted to the off side
excellent stop on his followthrough. Was hit back like a rocket. Both batsmen looking to play shots now
ripper of a bouncer on middle and leg, de Kock ducks to watch it buzz past the ear
a diving Kapugedara at point takes the pace off that square drive, Malinga comes around at third man to cut that off
crunched! Picks the gap to perfection at midwicket. Beautiful head position, firm balance as he puts away the overpitched delivery without much fuss. All class
onto the back foot as he bunts the away-going length ball to point
turns the length ball wide of midwicket. Best over of the innings. Can you believe it? Seven off it
skidder outside off from around the stumps, de Kock shapes to cut but is beaten. Wasn't all that short for him to play that shot
squirted to deep point. Driven inside-out this time
tossed up on off stump, eases it between cover and point
floated full on middle, turned to midwicket
gets across the stumps and works it behind square for an easy single
floated full on the pads, worked with the angle to deep midwicket

beauty of a delivery to get a class batsman. Keeps at it - full and just around off stump - this one nips away slightly off the pitch, de Kock pushes feebly with minimal feet movement and gets a thick edge that has been pouched well by a diving Dickwella. Reward for persistence. Subdued knock from de Kock, didn't quite look a part today
squeezes the full-length delivery to mid-off
plays outside the line as this one nips back in a long way to hit him high on the thigh pad. Bounce as well. Faf caught off guard with the pace on that delivery.
good ball. Length delivery that skids through outside off, watched through to the keeper
right behind the line of that length ball as he defends
chopped behind point to get off the mark
drifting into middle and leg, Faf hit on the pad as he tries to work it wide of midwicket
slider down leg, Dickwella does well to move swiftly to stop that
driven with the spin to long-off. Too full on this occasion
works it straight to midwicket. Plenty of drift again
makes room and punches the short ball to cover
width and put away. Opened the bat face late to steer that behind point. Races to the boundary
slides back in to rap Amla on the pad, but the angle would've taken it down leg. This one just skid straight on. Stifled appeal
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away through square leg
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite come on to the bat as du Plessis looks to punch through cover. Plays too early and jabs it back to the bowler
bouncer over middle and leg, du Plessis lets it go through to the keeper. Turns to the square leg umpire to see if he'll wide it - he doesn't. Tight one
back of a length close to off stump, punched to short extra
drifts onto the pads, tucked away to the left of long leg. They know Malinga's stationed there, and they hustle through for two
fuller now, close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover
fullish on leg stump, clipped through square leg
more flight on this, drifts in towards middle and leg, very full. Wants to drive inside-out through cover, the drift forces him to play to mid-on instead
full on off stump, driven to short cover

there's that drift again, and this drops on a nice length on off stump and goes on with the angle. Amla plays for turn, looking to drive into the covers, and gets an inside-edge that runs away through backward square leg
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
fullish close to off stump, pushed into the point region
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to short extra-cover

dropped, oh what have you done, Lasith? Sees him stepping out early and bangs it in short, just outside off. Goes for the pull, only manages a top-edge, and Malinga, stepping backwards at the long leg boundary, steps on the boundary cushions, and loses a bit of balance while having to move forward again. Dives forward and the ball slips through his fingers. Didn't get his palms under it
length ball, fourth-stump line, defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and uses his wrists to work it into the midwicket region
short on off and middle, pulled to deep square leg
length ball outside off and that's neatly done, shuffles across early, then lets it come on and opens his bat face at the last moment to guide this to the right of slip
shortish outside off, stabbed away through point
ooh, stays on the back foot to a length ball which ends up going with the angle towards off stump. Stays nicely balanced, though, makes a bit of room and punches it away to the right of sweeper cover
tossed up slower on off stump, stretches out and defends into the point region
flighted ball outside off, drags a flat-bat drive to the man at short extra-cover
quicker now, length ball that goes straight on towards off and middle, defended off the front foot
this is the legbreak, drifts in towards middle stump and turns away. Defended with an open face towards point
slanted across into a fifth-stump line, just back of a length, slapped away through backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched back towards the bowler, who fields it with a tumble in his follow-through
length ball on middle stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
floated up outside off, clipped away through forward square leg
makes room, Amla, stands a couple of inches outside leg stump even before the bowler releases, and clears his front leg to make even more room and launch an off-stump ball, quite full, over mid-off

good ball, pitches on a good length on leg stump and continues with the angle instead of cutting in as is usually the case. Looks to whip it into the leg side and gets a leading edge that rolls towards mid-off
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
flights this wide of off stump and du Plessis drags a sweep out to deep square leg
full on off stump, driven to long-off
and again, the sweep. This time he's into position a little earlier to the flighted ball wide of off stump, and uses his bottom hand to whip it further behind square and pick up four
length ball on middle and leg, punched to long-on
back of a length on off stump, slides on with the angle. Goes back, makes a bit of room, and pushes into the cover point region
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
length ball turns into the pads, clipped through backward square leg and they pick on Malinga again to hurtle through for two
back of a length on leg stump, whipped down to deep backward square leg
back of a length, nips in towards off stump. Shuffles across to work through square leg
onto the pads, clipped to the left of short fine leg
full outside off, whipped to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
a bit more width, slapped away to the right of sweeper cover
and again, on the shorter side outside off, this one's stabbed straight to backward point
short again, on the stumps this time, pulled away in the air, rolls down into the vacant deep midwicket region, and that brings up South Africa's 100

short and wide, slapped away to the right of the diving backward point fielder, and sweeper cover isn't square enough to cut this off. It was close enough to the backward point fielder to count as a misfield
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover to bring up Amla's 34th fifty in ODIs. He's really picking up pace now
slower ball on the pads, a poor ball given that fine leg is inside the circle. Amla just clips it away to his left and picks up an easy boundary
length ball on off stump, nice tight line, defended towards the fielder running in from point
length ball on middle and leg, clipped away to deep square leg
length ball, fourth-stump line, lets it come on and taps it at the top of its bounce - a la Kane Williamson - to knock it down towards third man
wide-ish yorker, stabbed to backward point
bouncer, gets up towards Faf's left shoulder, keeps the hook down and the short fine leg fielder does well to stop it with a full-length dive to his left
tossed up slow wide of off, forces the batsman to make all the power himself. Drags a flat-bat drive to short extra
this time the line is closer to off stump, even though it's still outside off, and Faf gets down low to slog-sweep to the deep midwicket boundary
short and wide, swatted away to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length, looks to make room to play through the off side and the ball hurries through straight, cramping him. Jams his bat down quickly to defend
knows Amla wants to go off-side, bowls it quick and full on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
down the track now and that's a sweet connection. Sees a bit of flight and the line is outside off - plenty of swinging room to slog that away crisply over midwicket
back of a length outside off, looks for the stab through point or third man, and he's beaten by a bit of away movement
length ball, a bit of off-cut into middle and off, clipped to short midwicket
looks for the full, dipping slower ball, ends up slinging it a long way down the leg side
back of a length on middle and off, looks to defend, ends up squeezing it into the square leg region off the inside half of the bat
length ball on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball to steer it down to third man
full outside off, driven firmly towards the diving backward point fielder, who gets a hand to it to deflect it to his right, and the man at deep point mops up
back of a length, a bit of inward nip into middle stump, tucked away through backward square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away through square leg
full on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball on the pads, clipped to the left of long leg
and again, on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
once again, on leg stump, tucked into the square leg region for another single
on the pads again, worked away through forward square leg
short ball, sits up nicely on off stump and du Plessis pulls powerfully in front of square
this one's not quite as short, hurries through at thigh height on off stump, drags the pull away through square leg
back of a length outside off, a bit of late away movement to beat Amla's attempted dab to third man
another short ball pulled on the bounce to the man at deep square leg
another short ball close to off stump, this time he's pulled to the left of the man at deep square leg - they pick up two and bring up the century partnership
short again, gets up towards the right shoulder this time, keeps the pull down nicely, to the right of that overworked man at deep square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, whipped away to deep square leg and du Plessis brings up fifty now
back of a length on leg stump, worked away through backward square leg
full on leg stump, clipped through square leg
length ball on middle and off, clipped to the right of midwicket, excellent positive running to get the single quite comfortably
full on off stump, whipped to long-on
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
short on off stump, pulled away through midwicket
makes room to try and hit through the covers, and Lakmal bowls it short and a little wider outside off, gets a bit of away movement off the pitch as well. Slash and miss
short again, on off and middle, pulled to the right of deep square leg
short outside off, slapped to deep point
back of a length outside off, and Amla, not for the first time, is beaten by some seam movement and bounce while trying to guide the ball to third man
length ball on the pads, worked away through square leg, rinse, repeat
and again. Back of a length on the pads, goes deep in his crease to whip it to the right of deep square leg

ooh, good ball. See? You don't have to bowl everything on the pads. Angles this across the stumps from around the wicket, floats it up fuller. Plays for the offcutter, closes his bat face early, and sends a leading edge dangerously towards short cover, but on the bounce
length ball slanting across towards off stump, dabbed to short third man
full on leg stump, whipped away powerfully and the fielder at square leg dives right to make an excellent stop
full on the pads, steps back in his crease to tuck this through backward square leg
tossed up on middle, driven back to the bowler
drifting into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
fired full outside off, du Plessis drills this into the gap at extra cover. Classy. No chance for the man at deep cover even though he was no more than 10 yards away
fired into the pads, whipped into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Excellent running again
sliding into the pads, nurdled behind square as they jog the single
can't get it through this time, tried to pick the gap between third man and point
whips a length delivery from outside off to deep midwicket
worked straight to midwicket. Tried to shuffle across to play it square though
this was too full, asking to be hit and Amla used his strong wrists to pick the gap
flatter on middle and leg, whipped to the man at deep backward square leg
looked to work it to midwicket but the ball drifted away to roll off the leading edge to cover
too short, enough time to hop across to whip it to deep square
flatter one outside off from wide of the crease, forced to sweeper cover
looked to swipe this over long-on but toe-ended it to the man at the edge of the ring at midwicket. Got too close to the delivery
shapes to drive but the ball drifts in to roll back to the bowler off an inside edge
fired full on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
too short, he makes room and cuts it to sweeper cover
makes room and drives inside-out to wide long-off
skiddy length ball on off stump, bunted behind point
close to the stumps at length, eased to square third man. Sensible
rocket hit over point. Too much width, Faf had the width as he slapped that away

excellent catch by Chandimal at midwicket. This was short, he tried to flat-bat this into the midwicket boundary but the ball got slightly big on him and cramped him for room, so couldn't generate as much power as he would have liked. Chandimal dived low to his right held his composure to pull off a super catch.
scorcher of a drive to deep cover to get off the mark
digs in a short ball outside off, Amla drops his wrists and lets it go
tossed up on middle, he makes room and eases it with the spin to wide long-off
fired full on middle and leg, turned wide of Malinga at short fine. Lucky to get away with that delivery
looked to go over cover but could only manage a thick outside edge past short third man

soft dismissal! Tries to rock back to pull but the ball didn't get to him as quickly as he anticipated. He was way too early into the stroke, the ball spun away a wee bit as well to hit the toe-end as the ball lobbed to cover. Simplest of catches for Kapugedara
crunching drive to get off the mark. Too full, he leans forward and belts this past mid-off. Full swing, free flow of the bat
eased back to the bowler this time
sliding into the pads, worked to fine leg
beauty. Nips away off the seam to shave past the outside edge. Miller played down the wrong line. Squared up too.
beaten on the drive. Feet nowhere near the pitch of the ball as he chases a wide delivery.
quick bouncer at 140kph on middle, Miller ducks under that one
hops back and across to bunt the length ball to cover for a quick single
walked across to pull but Pradeep saw that and angled in the short ball towards middle. Amla ducks, Aleem Dar signals wide. Touch too high
pulled from outside off to deep square leg
slider on the pads, nurdled wide of short fine leg
eased with the spin to long-on
gets to the pitch of the ball and bunts it down for an easy single
steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it cleanly over the bowler's head. The ball drifted into his swinging arc, sailed over comfortably
shortens his length as he sees Miller give him the charge, defended back to the bowler this time
fired full on the pads, flicked into the gap at midwicket
play and a miss. Tried to run it down to third man with an angled bat
crunching cover drive on the up to the boundary rider
floated full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
short-arm jab to deep square leg. This was a rocket hit he fetched from outside off
hops back and across to keep out the short of length delivery angling away
full and straight on middle, Miller's far too across to drive, forced to squeeze it back to midwicket
nurdled to fine leg as they jog the single
drifts back into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
works it with the spin to midwicket. Eye contact and they're off for the single
tossed up on off stump, punched wide of the diving cover fielder
hit hard but straight to cover
milks this to deep square leg as they amble across
starts off with a full length delivery on off stump, squeezed to cover
slides one onto middle and leg, wristed behind square leg
walks across the stumps and squeezes the full-length delivery to backward point
arches back to manufacture some room and runs it down to third man
ripper of a yorker, right in towards Amla's toes. Does well to clear it and jam his bat down in time to squeeze it out
looks to slip in another yorker outside off, not quite there, he squeezes it to mid-off. Excellent comeback over from Malinga
drifts in a full ball from wide of the crease, bunted to cover
swept from outside off to deep backward square leg
floated on middle and leg, defended to short midwicket
works it towards deep square where Malinga takes a while to get to the ball, back for the second quite comfortably
once again at length on middle and leg, whipped to deep backward square leg
tossed up on middle, bunted to mid-off
starts off with one a touch ahead of length on off stump, gets across the stumps and blocks

big appeal, Aleem Dar says not-out. Sri Lanka have used their review! This one nipped away off the seam from length outside off, Amla looks to open the face of the bat to steer this down to third man but was late on the shot. Snicko says there was no nick

works it off his hip to square leg and bring up his 25th ODI ton. Saw through a slow start but used his smarts to pick the scoring in the middle overs even as Sri Lanka were trying to finish their fifth-bowler quota.
looks to fetch this whip from outside off but ends up getting a thick leading edge that flies to third man. The angle and extra bounce have done the trick.
quality stroke. Uses the depth of the crease to manufacture the length and then opened the bat face to steer that towards square third man
hops across and punches a length ball back to the bowler
gets outside the line of the stumps and paddles it down to deep fine leg
eased towards cover for a quick single

is this a big moment? Amla is run-out while trying to slide back in for the second. He tucked this to the man at the edge of the ring at midwicket. Kusal Mendis swooped in quickly and then fired a accurate throw on the bounce to Dickwella who smashed the stumps down to catch Amla at least a foot short. Tired end to a fabulous knock. Amla took a while to turn for the second and that cost him
looks to back away and swing over the bowler's head, didn't get to the pitch so had to lunge forward and defend in the end
appeal for caught behind as Morris tries to paddle, way outside leg
mistimes an attempted lofted hit back to the bowler
drilled down to long-off
short,  a bit of width, and Morris puts it away nicely, waits on it and slaps it at the top of its bounce to beat third man running to his right
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards backward point
bouncer, pounds the pitch and gets it up quickly, over middle stump, and Morris ducks low to evade it
back of a length on off stump, Morris opens his bat face to slice it away to the left of backward point
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away through midwicket

short, that's not a bad ball at all - it skidded through towards Morris' right hip, and cramped him for room slightly, but he still managed to swivel and pull with enough power to find the midwicket boundary
low full toss outside off, driven to sweeper cover
excellent stop at extra cover. Seekkuge, I think it is. Struck firmly and was at least two had it beat him
cracking stroke. Off-cutter but this is too full. Not much the ball can do if you bowl it there, Morris gets to the pitch and crashes that wide of mid-off
bunts one to the man coming in from point for a quick single
deliberately done! Full and drifting away, Duminy opens the bat face late to steer it wide of the keeper
low full toss outside off, squeezed to third man
edged, not sure if this was deliberate. Looked to squeeze this behind point but got a minute deviation to beat Dickwella's dive. No third man
carved away to square third man
flicks a low full toss straight to midwicket
can't get underneath that yorker sliding into the pads, deflects to short fine leg
walks across the stumps to paddle a full delivery behind square. With the angle, it was always going to be a tough proposition. Beaten
sees the batsman walking away and floats this a touch outside leg. Duminy misses the flick. Umpire signals wide, JP has a wry smile. Harsh call.
once again tries to fetch a sweep from outside off but can't get any bat to it
deliveries like these won't help the over-rate. Another full delivery sliding down leg. Morris can't get any bat to it
makes room and carves the full ball on middle to deep cover
right into the blockhole, squeezed to long-on
another shocker of a delivery. This one perhaps slipped out of his hand, way down leg. Keeper does well to dive across to collect it

missed opportunity? Malinga was in the firing line as this was smashed back towards him. He looked away initially but realised this one was within reach. By the time he tried to go for it, the ball had passed him
attempts to loft this over long-on, ends up being a flat hit to the fielder
makes room to go over cover, gets a thick inside edge to long-on
clever. This time he gets right underneath that full toss and scoops it over short fine leg. Walked outside the line and then used the pace to pick his spot
gets a full delivery to tail back into middle, squeezed to mid-off
eases this one down to mid-on
makes room and carves this to sweeper cover
attempted yorker, turns out to be a low full toss outside off, squeezed to sweeper cover

sensational from Tharanga. One stump to aim at from mid-off, clean pick up and a rocket throw at the bowler's end. Morris, who hammered it straight to the fielder, had given up and was caught comfortably short.
squeezed into the gap between short third man and point. Very clever. Too full and angling away, he tried to go over cover but adjusted to open the bat face late to pick his spot
backs away and eases this into the gap at wide long-off, excellent running
through with the attempted whip. This one cut away off the deck to beat the bat. On the bounce to the keeper
looks to swing this over deep midwicket but got nowhere to the pitch of the ball. Another slow off-cutter from Malinga. Played too early
chipped in the air but Malinga does well to slide to his left to stop that on the bounce
sliced over point, Seekkugge was running back in an attempt to dive but it kept drifting away from him
another slower ball, another thick edge that swirls over short third man. Do they have a run-out here? It was a sharp throw from Pradeep but Parnell was just in.
looks to fetch the sweep from outside off, but is beaten
sees the batsman walking across and spears a yorker on off stump, squeezed to point
yorker length outside off. Parnell backed too far away and had to stretch to reach that. Well done, Pradeep.
once again full and straight, not allowing Parnell to get underneath the delivery as he backed away to slog, squeezed to mid-off
drilled down the ground, bisects long-on and long-off. Missed his yorker by an inch, if not more. Enough for Duminy to generate enough power

walks across, takes it on the full and swings this one over deep midwicket. So Duminy has somewhat made up for the initial struggle. Played a couple of deft strokes and has now finished off in a flurry
back of a length, misses his line first up, down the leg side as Dickwella misses the flick. Not called wide, though. Clipped the thigh pad, maybe
back of a length, slanting across into a fourth-stump line, defended into the off side
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and pushes with soft hands into the off side - mid-off has a long way to run in - and they run a quick single to get their innings underway
shortish, a bit of width, opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
ooh, first signs of aggression. Makes a lot of room to try and carve over the covers. Pulls his length back appropriately, and beats Dickwella's angled bat. Bounces over off stump
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face to push into the point region
starts with a full one on leg stump, looking to cramp Dickwella, who likes to stay leg-side of the ball. Clipped to mid-on
even fuller, this one's close to being a leg-stump yorker. Blocked into the leg side
full outside off, opens his bat face to push to backward point
full once more, on the stumps, driven firmly down the ground, past the stumps at the other end, and Tahir does well to make a diving stop after running to his right from mid-on
onto the pads, flicked away to long leg
down the track, making himself a lot of room, and even Parnell's attempt to fire it into his feet can't deny him. Keeps a nice and still head and lifts this up and over cover
back of a length on leg stump, defended into the on side

dropped! He may have had more time than he thought, but it was still a return catch. Short ball, angling across Tharanga, and he is in no position to pull this from outside off stump. Bounced up to head height as well. Only manages to pop it back to the bowler, who got both hands to it at waist height, but couldn't hold on
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
146kph bouncer angled across the left-hander. De Kock has to jump to collect that, and Tharanga barely had to duck. Signalled wide
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
pitches outside leg, angling towards the pads, and Tharanga misses out. A little late to get his bat around to flick, and the ball pops off the pad into the square leg region
length ball on off stump, stays back to defend into the cover point region
once again he exposes all his stumps while attempting to make room, and Parnell follows him with a back-of-a-length delivery. Defended into the off side
makes room again, and this time Parnell bowls it full on off stump. Goes for the loft over cover, and ends up slicing it off the outside edge, way over the slips
now, in an attempt to follow Dickwella, Parnell slips a full wide down the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away quietly through midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, whipped away to long leg
slower ball on off stump, full, and Dickwella puts it away beautifully. Makes room again, and slices it up and over point
follows Dickwella now, fires it at his feet as he steps away from the stumps. Clipped away to deep square leg
shot! That's a pick-up whip, from off stump, against the angle, and it flies over forward square leg and rolls away quickly to the boundary

half-chance. Again, straight back at Rabada. This one's full on leg stump, and Rabada denies him room with the full ball. Goes through with the drive and presents a hard, flat, low chance that he gets his right hand to but can't hold on
full on leg stump, clipped away to the right of long leg
full, a bit of width, gets down on his back knee and drives to wide mid-off. Rabada has overstepped by a fair margin
full, slanted away from off stump, opens his bat face to steer it to deep point
steps across this time rather than away from leg stump. Bowls a length ball on leg stump and he misses the flick, rolls off the outside of the pad towards long leg
short ball, gets up to chest height while cramping Tharanga for room. Swivels into his pull with his eye off the ball and it hits him on the body
back of a length on leg stump, looks for that pick-up shot again and ends up scooping it up without achieving the distance intended. Clears the man running towards the boundary from square leg
angles this down the leg side, and Dickwella gets a little tickle of pad on it to send it racing away to the fine leg boundary
full outside off, stabbed to backward point
ooh. Finally a straightforward, good-length ball in the corridor, and Dickwella pokes at it with no footwork. Thick inside-edge rolls away past the stumps
short now, on off stump, and Tharanga smacks it away, opens up in a flash to pull to the right of midwicket
length ball angling in towards off stump, blocked into the covers
Doesn't adjust immediately to the change of angle. Looks for the short ball and slips it a long way down the leg side
shortish, angling into off stump, makes himself room and slaps to backward point
off-stump yorker, jams his bat down to stab it back to the bowler

makes a lot of room again, and Rabada angled a quick bouncer straight at his body, getting it up to shoulder height. Somehow, he swayed his upper body away to create some room for his hands, and swatted it away to third man
bang. Looks to follow Dickwella again, bowls a length ball, and he just opens up at the hips to whip it away over midwicket
Oh, shot. Brilliant. Length ball on off stump, and Dickwella uses his wrists this time to whip it over square leg
looks to follow Dickwella with another bouncer, and slants it too far down leg once again
yorker on middle and off, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and tucks it softly into the leg side
fullish outside off, a bit of width but not a half-volley, and Tharanga slashes and misses, looking to drive on the up
this one is overpitched, a little closer to off stump, and he just leans on it, shows the full face, and beats cover point to his left
short outside off, and again Parnell's short ball has sat up to be hit. Tharanga pulls it away wide of mid-on
length ball on off stump, stays on the back foot and whips to the right of short fine leg
in the blockhole outside off, lets it come on and steers it to backward point with an open face
length ball angling in towards off stump, pushes to the left of mid-off with a straight bat

length ball, angling into off stump, and Morne has taken out the danger man. Clears his front leg and looks to slam that over mid-off. A bit of extra bounce, and he only manages to slice it high in the air, down into the hands of third man
back of a length on off stump, jumps to ride the bounce and defends towards point
back of a length, fourth-stump line, defended to backward point
short this time, on off stump, and Mendis puts it away. Takes it from just over chest height, rolls his wrists over, and pulls it through straight midwicket
oh, super. Full, angling into the pads, and Mendis clips it sweetly over midwicket
ooh, good ball. A bit of extra bounce in the corridor. Tharanga looks to drive on the up and the ball beats his outside edge
full outside off, and he just loves width. Especially when it's also overpitched. Opens his bat face slightly and sends the ball racing away to the left of cover point
ooh, beauty. Length ball in the corridor, a bit of nip away off the pitch, beats Tharanga's defensive push
fullish on off stump, gets on the front foot for a push to mid-off
lovely. A touch short, a tiny bit of width, and he leans back, waits, and chops it away to the left of third man

Parnell's short balls have been disastrous today. Whenever he's tried them, they've sat up at pullable height. This one's outside off, and Tharanga swivels stylishly to put it away between mid-on and midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends with soft hands, manages to squeeze it past Duminy, who dives to his left at backward point to try and stop it
ooh. Back of a length, angling into off stump and straightening slightly. Looks to use the angle to work it leg side, ends up getting a thick edge that rolls away to third man
shortish outside off, gets on top of the bounce to push towards point

shortish again, a bit more width. Plays with a more horizontal bat this time to slap it away past Duminy, who muffs up a fairly straightforward stop after moving quickly to his right from backward point
short, a bit of width, Tharanga misses out as the ball sneaks past his attempted cut
length ball on middle stump, clipped away quietly through forward square leg
back of a length, angling across to off stump. Lets it come on and dabs it down to third man
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs softly into the point region to enable the quick single

taken! Mendis picked up one boundary with an uppish flick, but this time AB has stationed himself at a straight short midwicket. The ball, angling into the stumps and pitching on a good length, stopped on Mendis slightly, maybe, and AB jumps, times it just about perfectly, and plucks the ball out with an outstretched right hand. The ball was almost behind him when he caught it
full outside off, nice stride forward to drive with an open face to the left of backward point
short outside off, left alone
fuller now, outside off again, Chandimal leaves again
a third leave in a row. Hits the deck, just back of a length, in the corridor
back of a length, angling into off stump, tucked away to the right of square leg, where Parnell makes a diving stop
short, angling into the body and gets up to rib height. Jumps to ride the bounce and tucks it away to long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball, nibbles into the left-hander off the seam to beat Tharanga's inside edge and hit back pad as he looks to defend. Pitched outside leg, though, so not much of an appeal
slanting away from off stump this time, Tharanga tries to cut and misses. Not short enough for the stroke
back of a length on middle stump, worked gently into the midwicket region
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
full, angling into middle stump, whipped away to the left of long leg to bring up Sri Lanka's 100
length ball angling into off stump. Gets on the front foot to defend and a bit of extra bounce ensures the ball hits high on the bat, near the sticker
pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket. Steep bounce, so it's risky. Kept it all along the ground this time though
width and he's crashed that into the point boundary. 'Hit me' ball from Morkel.
shoulders arms to a back of length delivery that nips away from outside off
in that drivable channel outside off, left alone
offers the full face of the bat to defend the incoming delivery
gets a good stride forward and defends
Gangulyesque timing. Width on offer, opens the bat face to steer that away to square third man. Sublime timing
punched away to deep point. Not much of a followthrough. Nice, high elbow as ball met bat. Morris on the shorter side at the moment
slides a length ball down leg. Chandimal misses the tickle because of the angle
gets forward gently to keep out that incoming length ball
slants back into the pads, worked wide of midwicket
beauty. Awkward length, awkward angle. Tharanga caught on the hop as he looks to fend. Steep bounce nearly had him
short ball angled into the body, Tharanga on the move with both feet off the ground as he bunts it to the leg side
length ball that stops on Tharanga as he looks to work it to the leg side. Briefly in the air but away from Morkel on his followthrough
hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work the length ball off his hip to square leg
ill-directed delivery. Once again looking to tickle it fine but the direction was taking it down the leg side. Wasted effort
half-stop at square leg takes pace off the ball. Tharanga struck the pull quite well. Rolled his wrists o ver the ball to keep it down
too easy for any batsman worth his salt at this level. Leg-stump half-volley which Chandimal flicks into the gap at deep midwicket
in-between length. Not all that short, but not a half-volley either, Chandimal caught on the crease as he defends
worked behind square, fine leg comes around to cut that off
slider on middle and leg, whipped straight to midwicket

the celebration in the South African camp tells you why that is a big moment in the match. Chandimal struck this firmly but de Villiers anticipates the dive and moves swiftly to his right from extra cover to slide and half-stop. Then quickly recovers to run a few paces to pick up the ball and hit the stumps direct at the bowler's end to catch Chandimal at least a feet short. Stunning
quicker one outside off, steered to point
fired full on off stump, eased down to long-off

the wrong'un has done the trick. Didn't look like Kapugeradara picked it. This one drifted back in a long way from wide of the crease, Kapu plays for the turning legbreak, stabs outside the line in an attempt to nurdle it to the legside and is struck plumb in front of middle. First-ball duck. Sri Lanka are sliding here
pushed through quicker outside off, pushed to cover
skiddy bouncer angling in from wide of the crease, Tharanga arches back and sees this zip past his helmet
wrong line, slides this one down leg as de Kock collects
mistimes a drive but it's wide of cover as they scamper a quick single
sweetly driven on the up over the infield, to sweeper cover
squared up by the length on middle, turned to the leg side nonetheless
mistimes a short-arm jab wide of mid-on. Risky second which they somehow complete. Wasn't far from AB de Villiers
punched through the line to deep cover, Parnell little late to get off the blocks but they don't risk the second this time
lunges forward and defends
tossed up on middle, Tharanga gets forward and defends
slider outside off, steered to backward point
fired on middle and leg, nurled behind square

beaten by the weong'un. De Kock was keen on the stumping and didn't appeal. They decide against a review. Tharanga is deceived by the slider. Played inside the line of this googly that hit one particular spot and deviated a long way.
pushed through quicker on middle, solidly behind the line.
backs away and cuts to the left of short third man. Didn't have the width to play the full-blooded stroke
eased with the spin to deep cover
fired full on middle from around the stumps, he lunges forward and blocks
too full on middle, defended back to the bowler

fired down leg, looks to paddle it fine but is beaten by the pace. Good glove work by de Kock, who may have been blinded by the batsman. They went upstairs just to be sure the backfoot wasn't in the air as the bails were knocked off. All good in the end.
drifting into middle and leg, looks to work it with the angle but is hit on the pad
slider on middle, bunted back to the bowler
gets forward and eases it down to long-on
too full on the stumps, squeezed past a diving Tahir to long-on
leans forward and turns the flighted delivery to short midwicket
picks the googly off the hand and is right behind the line as he blocks
on the shorter side, whipped to square leg

went for the full-blooded drive but this one spun away sharply as Tharanga ended slicing it wide of point. Miller with a wayward throw from the deep. Could've been a lot closer had it been quick and accurate at the bowler's end. Kusal was struggling
looks to force this through cover but doesn't have the room, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
walks across to sweep this low full toss from off stump to deep backward square leg. Hint of risk but he made a conscious effort of getting outside the line to play it
drifting into the pads, can't get this away as it beats his defensive shot to hit pad
fired full outside off, can't get underneath the delivery, squeezed back to the bowler again
off a thick inside edge to mid-on. Looked to drive, drift did him there
squeezed with the spin to cover

that is a freebie and Tharanga pounces on it. Rocks back and pulls this half-tracker into the midwicket boundary. The percentage of such deliveries have considerably come down, and when it comes your way, you better take toll
follows it up with a full delivery, a wrong'un, on off stump, eased wide of cover with the spin
a messy effort by Rabada at point. Over-ran it, also didn't account for the spin as Tharanga punched that away
width but he smacks it straight to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
cut away but a diving stop by Morris at point. Threw himself to his right to effect a one-handed stop
too full on middle, eased down the ground to long-off
struck firmly but straight to point
back of length on off stump, bunted to cover
length on off, punched straight to cover
misfield at mid-on gives away a run. Rolled off a thick inside edge as Tharanga tried to drive. Lazy effort from Parnell too on his followthrough
mix-up but safe. Whipped to midwicket. Was halfway down the pitch when he turned back
veers back in from length, he gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
too full on off, eases to long-off

is that the game for South Africa? Tharanga has hit this straight to Miller at deep cover. He read the googly, got to the pitch of the ball to go over the infield. It was almost as if he forgot there was a man there. Miller was running in with the sun right in his eyeline but he did well to keep his balance
lunges forward and works the full ball with the spin to the leg side
chops the cut to slip. Picked the length but this was too close to the body
on the bounce to long-off, no timing whatsoever  behind that one. Wasn't sure if he wanted to hit that over the ropes or just chip it. Checked his shot at the last moment
gets a good stride forward and defends
back of length on off stump, punched to mid-off
slides into middle and leg, worked to Amla at deep square leg
good leave. Full and angling across the batsman. Two slips waiting for the nick so he's watchful
opens the bat face late to steer this down to third man
back of length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
hops back and across to pull, mistimes it to midwicket
slider on middle and leg, turned to the man coming in from square leg
gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks
fired full and straight on the stumps, eased to long-on
too full and too straight, drilled to long-off
lunges forward and blocks
steps out to flick but the ball dips on him to beat the stroke and hit him on the pad
looks to work it fine, the ball deflects off the pad to square leg
full and angling away, firmly driven to mid-off
crunching drive through the line to sweeper cover
much fuller on off stump, he gets half-forward and defends
slapped away but straight to deep point
dabs it gently to short cover and scampers across for a quick single
stabs forward with the bat well away from the pad, straight to cover
sliced to extra cover. Looked to hit him with the spin but didn't get to the pitch of the ball and spooned a simple catch to the man at the edge of the ring. Sri Lanka right on the edge.
tossed up full on middle and off, driven firmly back between the stumps and the non-striker, and long-on moves left to stop it
slants this across and lands it on a nice length close to off stump. Kusal is unsure if it'll turn in or not, and he defends into the off side after it comes back in
ah, excellent fielding at slip. Floated this up slow outside off and he brought his quick hands to play to play a flat-bat reverse-sweep. Amla dives to his left and stops it
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
length ball close to off stump, slapped towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched firmly down the ground but Morkel denies him a possible boundary, moving quickly to his right from mid-on and stopping it with a dive
full outside off, defended towards backward point
beauty. Length ball angled across the stumps, and Prasanna doesn't get any real stride forward to defend, beats his outside edge
slants this a little wider, again a good length. Prasanna is a little late moving across, looks for a dab towards third man, can't put bat to ball
and again. This one's fuller, slanting into a wide-ish channel outside off. A push and a miss, again not too much footwork
full outside off, driven to long-off
tossed up full outside off, driven to long-off
a touch short on leg stump, and Kusal puts it away, crouches a little since it wasn't a rank long hop, and then swivels quickly to pull to the right of the man at backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, goes back to work it to midwicket
full now, on off stump, looks to clip to long-on but midwicket moves quickly to his right and stops it with a dive
flighted much slower now, wide outside off, gets a good stride out, head over ball, to drive to long-off

length ball, a bit of late movement in towards middle stump. Kusal didn't really move his feet, cleared his front leg as if he was shaping to hit hard down the ground. Adjusted late to defend towards midwicket
shortish on off stump, hops across to ride the bounce and whip off the hips through square leg

another play and miss. Prasanna is struggling against Parnell's angle here. Nice length, slants this across and fairly wide outside off, looks to get forward and push into the covers and can't connect
shuffles across a long way to cover the angle, and ends up perhaps overdoing it, gets a thick inside-edge into his back leg

wow. After all those plays and misses, goes for the big slog against a length ball pitching on off stump. Lucky that his thick inside-edge, which ricocheted off his back thigh, didn't lob straight back to the bowler

and he closes the over, and his spell, by beating Prasanna's edge again. Subtle variations in length, this one was just a bit shorter than the previous few balls, and Prasanna, looking to defend, was still on the shuffle when the ball went past his bat
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended into the point region
length ball on off stump, punched towards mid-off
short now, and this one gets up to just the right height for Kusal to play his favourite short-arm pull, swivels and swats it away to the right of the deep midwicket fielder
length ball on off stump, opens his bat face to dab towards point
full on middle stump, clipped away through forward square leg
back of a length outside off, goes deep in his crease to try and shorten the length a little more, but can't beat point with his cut
length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, poked away into the vacant cover point region
back of a length on leg stump, worked away through square leg
back of a length outside off. Prasanna was on the front foot even before Rabada released, ends up playing a front-foot slap to deep point
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to the left of mid-on
shortish in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce to defend
back of a length on off stump, swatted away to deep square leg
slogged. Slogged hard. Bam. That was a back-of-a-length delivery in the fifth-stump channel, and he took a step forward and across and just clubbed it over straight midwicket, baseball-style
full, angling into off stump, shuffles across even before the bowler has released, and clips it away to long leg
shortish, angling into off stump. Shuffles across and works it to long leg
full on off stump, clipped towards midwicket
short outside off, really digs this into the pitch and Prasanna has to pull from over shoulder height. A difficult ask, and he doesn't quite middle it, but gets it into the gap to the right of mid-on
back of a length on middle stump, defended into the covers
length ball on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball and punches firmly but short extra dives left to ensure he won't get any runs for it
bouncer over leg stump, and that's nicely hooked, it was quick and skiddy and got up over his shoulder, but he stepped across the line and helped it away to the fine leg boundary
shortish, angling across to off stump. Looks to whip it into the leg side, ball beats him and hits high on the thigh
shortish, leg-stumpish. Can't quite connect with the tuck off the hips, ball hits his thigh and rolls down towards the keeper
back of a length on leg stump, tucked to backward square leg
floats this full on off stump, he's half-forward in defence

this one snakes back in from length on off stump, Prasanna pushes outside the line and is comprehensively beaten. Hit above the knee roll, closer to the flap of the pad. Ball tracking shows the ball would've gone on to hit the top of middle and leg. Three reds, Sri Lanka sink further. Prasanna had taken a step across with his front foot as the bowler released, and ended up in a completely closed-off position
full, angling into off stump, driven to the right of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers

back of a length on off stump, clubbed along the ground to mid-on, and is that another run-out? They think of a single, hesitate, turn around, and Tahir's direct hit catches Lakmal well short at the striker's end
in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
gone, Sri Lanka are nine down. Malinga stepped away to make room, Rabada banged it in short outside off. Was off-balance as he tried to cut, only managed a bottom-edge into his stumps
ooh, back of a length, angling into the stumps. Pradeep is nowhere in line to defend and the ball zips past his outside edge and over the stumps
back of a length, angling into leg stump. Moves away from the line again, defends into the off side
oh my. Snorting bouncer over off stump, the inward angle following the batsman all the way. Pradeep doesn't get his feet in line, which is good for him. Just about sways his upper body away
fuller now, on leg stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, shuffles away from leg stump and pokes it towards point
Down the track and the bowler responds with a full ball at the batsman's feet. Punched back to Morris
yorker on middle stump, makes some room and stabs towards point
length ball on off stump, makes some room and slaps it away in the air, to long-off's right
yorker on middle and off, defended into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, punched to extra-cover
sees him trying to make room and responds with the wide yorker. All Kusal can do is watch it through to the keeper
shortish outside off, moves away from the line and tries to dab into the off side, can't connect
another short ball, over leg stump this time as Pradeep steps away and exposes all three. Swats blindly at it, makes no contact
full on middle stump, Pradeep exposes his stumps again and swishes it away, over the top, into the cover boundary
full-toss on leg stump, punched away through cover point
short, rising over off stump. Looks to make room to slap it over point but it bounces too much for that
full on middle stump, clears his front leg and flat-bats powerfully down the ground, to the left of mid-off, to bring up Sri Lanka's 200
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
googly, pitching just short of a length well outside off. Surprised him but he coped well enough to defend into the off side
and that is that. Tahir finishes with four. A bit of flight, and Pradeep gives it the big yahoo. Connects pretty well, to be fair, but only manages to hit it as far as the man at long-on
